revised_title: Kew Observatory's Annual Report and Magnetic Survey Progress
tldr: The Kew Committee's annual report covers the operations and findings of Kew Observatory in 1890, focusing on magnetic and meteorological observations. The Magnetic Sub-Committee discusses the future format of the appendices to the report, and the observatory's work on the Magnetic Survey of Great Britain and Ireland is highlighted. The report also covers various meteorological observations, including atmospheric pressure, temperature, and humidity, as well as the use of self-recording instruments and the Times' Weather Chart. Additionally, the report mentions the Fort William Observatory, solar and sidereal transit observations, and cloud photography experiments.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Atmospheric Science
